intro: Desmos chinensis var. macropetalus, commonly known as the large-petaled desmos, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant has slender, woody stems and elliptical leaves with serrated edges. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. The flowers bloom in clusters and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
